summary: Diff partially implements click-to-advance for traveling segments by wiring a user-advance callback from RVExperience into TravelVideoScene and adding a guard against duplicate triggers. However, due to truncation, it’s not fully evidenced that TravelVideoScene actually triggers advancement on click/tap anywhere, nor that its timer-based checkpoint progression has been fully removed/neutralized. The diff also appears to introduce unrelated timing behavior (transition auto-continue and a post-checkpoint-3 delay) not requested in the BuildRequest.

missing_requirements.requirement: Trigger checkpoint arrival and opening CheckpointOverlay via a user click/tap anywhere on the traveling screen (no automatic timer-based checkpoint arrival), and ignore repeated clicks while transitioning/showing overlay.
missing_requirements.reason: RVExperience passes an `onUserAdvance` prop into TravelVideoScene and adds a duplicate-trigger guard, but the provided TravelVideoScene excerpt is truncated before any render/DOM handlers; there is no direct evidence in the shown code that a click/tap anywhere on the traveling scene calls `onUserAdvance`, nor that checkpoint overlays cannot be triggered by elapsed time while in traveling state.

missing_requirements.requirement: Remove/neutralize TravelVideoScene’s travel-duration timer logic for checkpoint arrival while keeping video stall detection and animated fallback intact.
missing_requirements.reason: TravelVideoScene still defines `onTravelTimeReached`, `enableTimer`, and `travelDuration` props, and the excerpt does not show whether any elapsed-time interval/timeout that triggers checkpoint progression has been removed or gated off. While video health monitoring/fallback logic is visible, the absence of timer-trigger code cannot be confirmed due to truncation.

missing_requirements.requirement: Update on-screen traveling guidance text to instruct click/tap to reach the next checkpoint (English only), without mentioning timing; keep existing checkpoint selection guidance unchanged.
missing_requirements.reason: The diff summary text mentions updated guidance, but the provided truncated code excerpts do not show any user-facing traveling hint text being rendered (nor confirm that checkpoint selection guidance remains unchanged).

hallucinated_features.description: Auto-continue behavior after a 'transition' state using a 2.5s timer.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested by REQ-23–REQ-26; introduces additional timed behavior unrelated to click-to-advance checkpoints.

hallucinated_features.description: A 'post-checkpoint-3-delay' state that delays showing a halt-issue overlay by ~2.5 seconds.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not part of the BuildRequest, which explicitly focused on replacing timed checkpoint arrival with click/tap; this adds new timing/state behavior around checkpoint 3.
